page.title: 01THE CRADLEY AREA
page.content: This is an area of outstanding beauty. It contains the village of Cradley which was originally called {CREDELAIE}and referred to in the Domesday book as such.Beautiful woodlands surround the village and there are very pleasant walks and bridle ways.It is a rural area and there is no industry to be found here.The farming in this area is mostly mixed with beef and dairy cattle,sheep and cereal crops.The area lies to the west of the Malvern Hills and is easily reached along the A 4103 Worcester to Hereford road.The church and the village hall are the principal monuments.The whole area is served by a village school which has about one hundred pupils.
